bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Telegram from George A. Kellogg to Philip Showalter Hench, May 16, 1941

div1.p: Kellogg will invite Ireland to the unveiling of the Cornwell painting. He discusses Hench's speech for the event.

div1.head: Telegram from George A. Kellogg to Philip Showalter Hench, May 16, 1941
div1.opener:
Postal Telegraph
Mackay Radio
Commercial Cables
TELEGRAMS
CABLEGRAMS
RADIOGRAMS
All America Cables
Canadian Pacific Telegraphs
Form-16 Dbl
------------------
19M WH TWS PAID 3 MINS
PAHP JERSEY CITY NJ 917A May 16 1941
DR PHILIP ;S HENCH MAYO CLINIC ROCHESTER MINN
div1.p:
WILL INVITE IRELAND AS GUEST BUT PREFER YOU FOR SPEAKER. A 15-MINUTE
INFORMAL TALK ON THE RELATIVE MERITS OF CHARACTERS IN THE PAINTING
AND SIGNIFICANCE OF YELLOW FEVER INVESTIGATION IN PUBLIC HEALTH
AND DEFENSE DESIRABLE. HOWEVER, USE YOUR OWN JUDGEMENT. PLEASE BRING
A DOZEN COPIES OF ADDRESS FOR REPORTERS. WE ARE VERY MUCH PLEASED
WITH YOUR ACCEPTANCE
